title: This Land Pt. Four
body:
Jon had helped you layer various leather and wool pieces of clothing on your body to help keep you warm. But, you were still cold. The only thing he had to offer?

“You’ll adjust.”

He told you it was best if you kept your hair down. That it helped give warmth to your neck and ears.

You hated the clothes. It took away from your normal silhouette  and made it look like a short, stubby man.

But it kept you warmer then before so you kept the layers on top of your shoulders, even if it did way you down like an anchor to the sea floor.

You stared at the horses with what, Jon, could only really place as fear. Your wide eyes making contact with the horse’s dark ones. It was like the two of you were having a staring contest.

Jon didn’t know exactly why, you knew how to read and write beyond well, you knew military strategy, yet you were afraid of a horse. It was larger than you. You were slim. Or, at least you had become slimmer since he first met you. Your khaki shirt had begun to look loose on you. And he had noticed the trousers you wore start to sag. Mainly because you kept trying to pull them up whenever they slipped down.

Were you losing weight? Was it the stress of being away from your home for so long? Was it the little people inside your old box? Was the same music growing boring?

He couldn’t answer any of that, all he could answer was your fear of the black horse that had your bag attached to him in the early morning.

Jon walked over to you, stepping in front of you. Breaking your gaze with the animal.

“Are you alright?”

“Mhm.” Was all you said, looking up at Jon, lips in a thin line as you held one of the bags Edd had unceremoniously thrown at you when you walked down the stairs when Jon had woken you up.

“Come on.” He said, gently resting his hand on the center of your back and pulling you up to the horse. “You can’t be afraid of horses if you want to be Westeros!” He said, grabbing hold go either side of your waist and setting you on the horse. Both legs on one side.

“I don’t like it.” You confirmed.

He laughed at your childishness before taking the reins and handing them to you.

“That leg on the other side.” He pointed to your right leg. “This one likes to run for no reason. Don’t want you falling off your horse.” He added before beginning to walk away.

“I’d like to see you fall off your high horse.” You grumbled under your breath.

Jon turned around, swiftly when he heard what you had said. Or, more like overheard what you had grumbled.

“What was that?”

“Hm? Oh, nothing” You responded joyfully.

Jon knew what you had said, and it only took him a third of a second to realize you had decided to be just a bit of a sass.

He laughed slightly “We’ll see.” He responded with a smile, finally walking over to his horse to mount it.

You kept your smile on your face “Prick.”

He heard that too

“Keep calling me names and I’ll have to do something.”

Your laughed boomed and echoed through castle black when he said that “I’d like to see you try!” You laughed once more, before he turned his horse around and trotted over to you.

“What will you do shortstack?” You inquired with a hint of snark in your tone and your facial expression.

“Shortstack?”

You looked at him quizzically “Like a Shortstack of Pancakes?” You asked as if he would get what you were talking about.

You huffed in defeat, giving up trying to get him to understand. “It means you’re short.”

It was his turn to have a bellowing laugh. You didn’t think you’d seen such a smile on his face. Or heard such a laugh. “I’m taller than you!”

You tilted your head, sympathetically. “Awww, but you’re not as tall as Dwayne Johnson.”

With that you turned your horse to follow the rest of the men to the ships that were at the shore.

“What was the poem again?” Jon questioned as he rode next to you, a hand extended out to your horse and helping you steer the horse since you could barely do it yourself.

“The Shakespear one? It’s a quote.”

“Can you recite it? Again, for me?”

You smiled and nodded having to think for a moment before getting the words together.

“To be, or not to be: that is the question:

Whether ’tis nobler in the mind to suffer

The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,

Or to take arms against a sea of troubles,

And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep;

No more; and, by a sleep to say we end

The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks

That flesh is heir to, ’tis a consummation

Devoutly to be wish’d. To die, to sleep;

To sleep: perchance to dream: ay, there’s the rub.”

You looked at him, and he was smiling at you. “You sound regal when you speak like that.”

You chuckled and rubbed the reins of the horse with the pad of your thumb and nodded

“Early modern english. Elegant early modern english. Many of the common people of England didn’t really speak so eloquently. More formal than me, but not as formal as Shakespear would write.”

He nodded “A famous writer?”

You shrugged slightly “Poet, playwright. He was many things.”


•••


“Dude!” You screamed as Jon tried to swing at you “Have you lost your mind!”

Jon could only tilt his head at you as you went to do an overhand throw of the sword. When you let go of it he realized what you were doing and he stumbled away as it was coming straight towards him.

When he saw and heard the steel sparring sword hit the side of the ship and go overboard, splashing in the icy cold waters all he could do was gawk at you.

“Have you?”

You only glared at him. “I already have enough bruises I don’t need more from those stupid non hurty swords!”

He shook his head at you. You weren’t just feisty, you were a mature 16 year old, who at times still acted like an angry three year old. He could imagine, that it would be annoying to some. But… he found it… endearing? The way you pouted when he said something about the things that the men in the Night’s Watch weren’t allowed, or when you made a joke he didn’t understand. The slumped shoulders that you would fake for a few seconds before making, yet another, joke he didn’t understand.

“When we collect wood for the arrows, it’s a hit or miss on whether or not they’ll work.”

You had leaned in incredibly close, Your leg touching his as you rode on horses, Head on his shoulder looking up at him.

“Hit or miss?”

He nodded slowly “Yes?”

“I guess they never miss, huh?”

“We miss quite a bit actually. We use most of the wood for fires. Quite ashamed of that actually”  He had admitted only for you huff and rest your head back on the neck of your horse.

But every once and awhile he’d tell a joke that you’d laugh at. He loved the sound of it. The laugh that made even Tormund look at you two and smile. Did Tormund nail it down that Jon liked you? No. Jon refused to think like that. Of course he didn’t! He didn’t know Jon that well! Did he?

Jon smiled at you and helped himself off the ground and set his sparring sword on the ground “Fine! We’ll practice your archery.”

That made you smirk. An evil glimmer showing in your eyes when he said that. Hands on your hips as he took you to the bows. Wanting you to see which bow would be better for your height and strength.

The longbow had better range you argued when he suggested a short bow.

“You might as well have a crossbow! You’re too short for a long bow!” He argued back.

“You don’t know me!” You retorted grabbing a long bow with black leather at the handle. It was easily taller than you, standing at six feet while you stood even below him, and he wasn’t six feet tall.

The handle was close to your nose.

You looked absurd. A stubborn woman who refused to use anything but a weapon that was larger than even herself. You knew it too, the moment you had it stood next to you. Eyeing the handle cautiously.

“Okay… Maybe I do need a shortbow.” the begrudging admission had Jon smirking at you as he grabbed a short bow and took the longbow from you and handed you the shortbow.

“It’s more your size”

Your tongue poked out at him in spite as you grabbed a quiver of arrows and marched to the targets that were set up on the ship.

He followed you, holding a tall shield as you stood, quiver already on your hip when he came over.

He placed the shield by your feet and got behind you. His chest against your back as he showed you how to hold the bow.

He was close. You felt as though he was so close he could read your thoughts. How he smelled faintly like a smoked bacon sandwich. They ate bacon at Castle Black. It wasn’t that good, but it still smelled the same. Smoke, maybe the forge? The sandwich part had to be bread. Or maybe you just wanted a Starbucks sandwich with a strawberry acai.

Was this what hunger was truly like?

You could feel his chest expanding as he breathed, holding your elbow up. You were on the ball and toes of your feet, trying not to step on his own shoes.

Yes, that’s how close he was. So close you could smell the sandwich and even the faint leather, and so close his feet were right under yours.

You didn’t feel nervous. No, this was confidence for at the very moment he began to speak, you loosed the arrow..

“Pap!”

You pulled another arrow from the quiver and pulled it back, loosing it, like the one before it, letting it hit the bulls eye like the other “Pap!”

“What?”

“The sound of a gun! Probably with a silencer!”

You turned your head to look at him only to have him looking at you with a questioning gaze for the millionth time since you met him, that’s when he looked to the target to see both arrows stuck in the bulls eyes.

“How-”

“I’m in marksmanship. And the rifle team… And I took archery as a kid… and my dad is kind of a gun enthusiast.”

He made a ‘huh’ noise, in surprise. He supposed you were full of surprises. From the music of your little box, and the clothing choice, to even now.

“Full of surprises.”

You shook your head. “Not really. Just a girl with a grudge against Jannine Handers. Whenever my dad took me to the shooting range, I would have my friends send me pictures of her, I would print them out and use them as my target.”

“What did she do to you?” he asked

“When we were three she ripped the bow off of my dress.” The seriousness in your voice made him look at you in worry.

“Thirteen years of a grudge… because she ripped a bow off of your dress? I can’t remember a single thing I was doing when I was three.”

“I do, minding my own business before Jannine Carly Handers ran up and ripped the red bow off of my dress.”

“Grudges like that can’t be healthy.”

He was still close.

“No, but I think my ancestors would be proud of me. The Plantagenets and Nevills were never civil. And neither am I.” You smirked as you loosed an arrow.

“Plantagenet, a strange French name, for an English family.” You added. “Maybe I’m also French.”

Jon didn’t understand what you were saying, but he listened. Loving the sound of your voice as you loosed arrows. He let you ramble, and you hadn’t even realized his hands were on your hips.

He let you ramble about the men and women who made history, he let you ramble about art and military.

“You would fail my rotc course. My PC would hate you with a burning passion.” The chuckle that came after warmed his heart.

“Why’s that?”

“Your hair. Your scruff. You have to have short hair, and no facial hair either. But, other than that I think you’d pass. Then again, I think you love your hair more than the rest of the world.”

He chuckled at that. “Oh really?” He pulled one of your copper coins that he had pocketed when you said they were practically worthless unless you were a child paying for bubblegum in complete pennies and quarters.

He held it up, “Penny for your backstory?”

You eyed the penny that was held between his index finger and thumb. “What’s the question?” You asked pulling an arrow back and letting it fly.

“What have you loved more than the rest of the world?”

You smiled slightly, falling back into his chest, one of his arms wrapping around your torso to keep you up, as he stumbled back a step.

“That’s three pennies.” You joked, not expecting him to pull two more pennies out of his pocket and handing them to your small hand. You looked at them in awe.

You didn’t even have to question you response, “Little Ceasar’s Pizza, with ranch, and a two liter of mountain dew on a Wendsday, watching The Handmaid’s Tale with my friends.”

“What friends?” He asked

“Two.” You held up two of your fingers

He forked over the worthless currency that you were using to play a game you hadn’t played in years, until now.

“Ariani, Eric and Rachel.” You pulled away from his grasp on your hips, and turned to face him. “Your turn snow.” You replied tossing the coins to him, that he effortlessly caught.

“I’ll give you time for your response. I know it’ll be hard to think about something other than your luscious locks, Shortstack.”


•••

@disneyprincessbuffyannesummers @strangerthingsholland@starkbelova @missminx1993 @blxkstar

“To be, or not to be: that is the question:

Whether ’tis nobler in the mind to suffer

The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,

Or to take arms against a sea of troubles,

And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep;

No more; and, by a sleep to say we end

The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks

That flesh is heir to, ’tis a consummation

Devoutly to be wish’d. To die, to sleep;

To sleep: perchance to dream: ay, there’s the rub.”

You looked at him, and he was smiling at you. “You sound regal when you speak like that.”

You chuckled and rubbed the reins of the horse with the pad of your thumb and nodded

“Early modern english. Elegant early modern english. Many of the common people of England didn’t really speak so eloquently. More formal than me, but not as formal as Shakespear would write.”

He nodded “A famous writer?”

You shrugged slightly “Poet, playwright. He was many things.”


•••


“Dude!” You screamed as Jon tried to swing at you “Have you lost your mind!”

Jon could only tilt his head at you as you went to do an overhand throw of the sword. When you let go of it he realized what you were doing and he stumbled away as it was coming straight towards him.

When he saw and heard the steel sparring sword hit the side of the ship and go overboard, splashing in the icy cold waters all he could do was gawk at you.

“Have you?”

You only glared at him. “I already have enough bruises I don’t need more from those stupid non hurty swords!”

He shook his head at you. You weren’t just feisty, you were a mature 16 year old, who at times still acted like an angry three year old. He could imagine, that it would be annoying to some. But… he found it… endearing? The way you pouted when he said something about the things that the men in the Night’s Watch weren’t allowed, or when you made a joke he didn’t understand. The slumped shoulders that you would fake for a few seconds before making, yet another, joke he didn’t understand.

“When we collect wood for the arrows, it’s a hit or miss on whether or not they’ll work.”

You had leaned in incredibly close, Your leg touching his as you rode on horses, Head on his shoulder looking up at him.

“Hit or miss?”

He nodded slowly “Yes?”

“I guess they never miss, huh?”

“We miss quite a bit actually. We use most of the wood for fires. Quite ashamed of that actually”  He had admitted only for you huff and rest your head back on the neck of your horse.

But every once and awhile he’d tell a joke that you’d laugh at. He loved the sound of it. The laugh that made even Tormund look at you two and smile. Did Tormund nail it down that Jon liked you? No. Jon refused to think like that. Of course he didn’t! He didn’t know Jon that well! Did he?

Jon smiled at you and helped himself off the ground and set his sparring sword on the ground “Fine! We’ll practice your archery.”

That made you smirk. An evil glimmer showing in your eyes when he said that. Hands on your hips as he took you to the bows. Wanting you to see which bow would be better for your height and strength.

The longbow had better range you argued when he suggested a short bow.

“You might as well have a crossbow! You’re too short for a long bow!” He argued back.

“You don’t know me!” You retorted grabbing a long bow with black leather at the handle. It was easily taller than you, standing at six feet while you stood even below him, and he wasn’t six feet tall.

The handle was close to your nose.

You looked absurd. A stubborn woman who refused to use anything but a weapon that was larger than even herself. You knew it too, the moment you had it stood next to you. Eyeing the handle cautiously.

“Okay… Maybe I do need a shortbow.” the begrudging admission had Jon smirking at you as he grabbed a short bow and took the longbow from you and handed you the shortbow.

“It’s more your size”

Your tongue poked out at him in spite as you grabbed a quiver of arrows and marched to the targets that were set up on the ship.

He followed you, holding a tall shield as you stood, quiver already on your hip when he came over.

He placed the shield by your feet and got behind you. His chest against your back as he showed you how to hold the bow.

He was close. You felt as though he was so close he could read your thoughts. How he smelled faintly like a smoked bacon sandwich. They ate bacon at Castle Black. It wasn’t that good, but it still smelled the same. Smoke, maybe the forge? The sandwich part had to be bread. Or maybe you just wanted a Starbucks sandwich with a strawberry acai.

Was this what hunger was truly like?

You could feel his chest expanding as he breathed, holding your elbow up. You were on the ball and toes of your feet, trying not to step on his own shoes.

Yes, that’s how close he was. So close you could smell the sandwich and even the faint leather, and so close his feet were right under yours.

You didn’t feel nervous. No, this was confidence for at the very moment he began to speak, you loosed the arrow..

“Pap!”

You pulled another arrow from the quiver and pulled it back, loosing it, like the one before it, letting it hit the bulls eye like the other “Pap!”

“What?”

“The sound of a gun! Probably with a silencer!”

You turned your head to look at him only to have him looking at you with a questioning gaze for the millionth time since you met him, that’s when he looked to the target to see both arrows stuck in the bulls eyes.

“How-”

“I’m in marksmanship. And the rifle team… And I took archery as a kid… and my dad is kind of a gun enthusiast.”

He made a ‘huh’ noise, in surprise. He supposed you were full of surprises. From the music of your little box, and the clothing choice, to even now.

“Full of surprises.”

You shook your head. “Not really. Just a girl with a grudge against Jannine Handers. Whenever my dad took me to the shooting range, I would have my friends send me pictures of her, I would print them out and use them as my target.”

“What did she do to you?” he asked

“When we were three she ripped the bow off of my dress.” The seriousness in your voice made him look at you in worry.

“Thirteen years of a grudge… because she ripped a bow off of your dress? I can’t remember a single thing I was doing when I was three.”

“I do, minding my own business before Jannine Carly Handers ran up and ripped the red bow off of my dress.”

“Grudges like that can’t be healthy.”

He was still close.

“No, but I think my ancestors would be proud of me. The Plantagenets and Nevills were never civil. And neither am I.” You smirked as you loosed an arrow.

“Plantagenet, a strange French name, for an English family.” You added. “Maybe I’m also French.”

Jon didn’t understand what you were saying, but he listened. Loving the sound of your voice as you loosed arrows. He let you ramble, and you hadn’t even realized his hands were on your hips.

He let you ramble about the men and women who made history, he let you ramble about art and military.

“You would fail my rotc course. My PC would hate you with a burning passion.” The chuckle that came after warmed his heart.

“Why’s that?”

“Your hair. Your scruff. You have to have short hair, and no facial hair either. But, other than that I think you’d pass. Then again, I think you love your hair more than the rest of the world.”

He chuckled at that. “Oh really?” He pulled one of your copper coins that he had pocketed when you said they were practically worthless unless you were a child paying for bubblegum in complete pennies and quarters.

He held it up, “Penny for your backstory?”

You eyed the penny that was held between his index finger and thumb. “What’s the question?” You asked pulling an arrow back and letting it fly.

“What have you loved more than the rest of the world?”

You smiled slightly, falling back into his chest, one of his arms wrapping around your torso to keep you up, as he stumbled back a step.

“That’s three pennies.” You joked, not expecting him to pull two more pennies out of his pocket and handing them to your small hand. You looked at them in awe.

You didn’t even have to question you response, “Little Ceasar’s Pizza, with ranch, and a two liter of mountain dew on a Wendsday, watching The Handmaid’s Tale with my friends.”

“What friends?” He asked

“Two.” You held up two of your fingers

He forked over the worthless currency that you were using to play a game you hadn’t played in years, until now.

“Ariani, Eric and Rachel.” You pulled away from his grasp on your hips, and turned to face him. “Your turn snow.” You replied tossing the coins to him, that he effortlessly caught.

“I’ll give you time for your response. I know it’ll be hard to think about something other than your luscious locks, Shortstack.”


•••

Jon had helped you layer various leather and wool pieces of clothing on your body to help keep you warm. But, you were still cold. The only thing he had to offer?

“You’ll adjust.”

He told you it was best if you kept your hair down. That it helped give warmth to your neck and ears.

You hated the clothes. It took away from your normal silhouette  and made it look like a short, stubby man.

But it kept you warmer then before so you kept the layers on top of your shoulders, even if it did way you down like an anchor to the sea floor.

You stared at the horses with what, Jon, could only really place as fear. Your wide eyes making contact with the horse’s dark ones. It was like the two of you were having a staring contest.

Jon didn’t know exactly why, you knew how to read and write beyond well, you knew military strategy, yet you were afraid of a horse. It was larger than you. You were slim. Or, at least you had become slimmer since he first met you. Your khaki shirt had begun to look loose on you. And he had noticed the trousers you wore start to sag. Mainly because you kept trying to pull them up whenever they slipped down.

Were you losing weight? Was it the stress of being away from your home for so long? Was it the little people inside your old box? Was the same music growing boring?

He couldn’t answer any of that, all he could answer was your fear of the black horse that had your bag attached to him in the early morning.

Jon walked over to you, stepping in front of you. Breaking your gaze with the animal.

“Are you alright?”

“Mhm.” Was all you said, looking up at Jon, lips in a thin line as you held one of the bags Edd had unceremoniously thrown at you when you walked down the stairs when Jon had woken you up.

“Come on.” He said, gently resting his hand on the center of your back and pulling you up to the horse. “You can’t be afraid of horses if you want to be Westeros!” He said, grabbing hold go either side of your waist and setting you on the horse. Both legs on one side.

“I don’t like it.” You confirmed.

He laughed at your childishness before taking the reins and handing them to you.

“That leg on the other side.” He pointed to your right leg. “This one likes to run for no reason. Don’t want you falling off your horse.” He added before beginning to walk away.

“I’d like to see you fall off your high horse.” You grumbled under your breath.

Jon turned around, swiftly when he heard what you had said. Or, more like overheard what you had grumbled.

“What was that?”

“Hm? Oh, nothing” You responded joyfully.

Jon knew what you had said, and it only took him a third of a second to realize you had decided to be just a bit of a sass.

He laughed slightly “We’ll see.” He responded with a smile, finally walking over to his horse to mount it.

You kept your smile on your face “Prick.”

He heard that too

“Keep calling me names and I’ll have to do something.”

Your laughed boomed and echoed through castle black when he said that “I’d like to see you try!” You laughed once more, before he turned his horse around and trotted over to you.

“What will you do shortstack?” You inquired with a hint of snark in your tone and your facial expression.

“Shortstack?”

You looked at him quizzically “Like a Shortstack of Pancakes?” You asked as if he would get what you were talking about.

You huffed in defeat, giving up trying to get him to understand. “It means you’re short.”

It was his turn to have a bellowing laugh. You didn’t think you’d seen such a smile on his face. Or heard such a laugh. “I’m taller than you!”

You tilted your head, sympathetically. “Awww, but you’re not as tall as Dwayne Johnson.”

With that you turned your horse to follow the rest of the men to the ships that were at the shore.

“What was the poem again?” Jon questioned as he rode next to you, a hand extended out to your horse and helping you steer the horse since you could barely do it yourself.

“The Shakespear one? It’s a quote.”

“Can you recite it? Again, for me?”

You smiled and nodded having to think for a moment before getting the words together.

“To be, or not to be: that is the question:

Whether ’tis nobler in the mind to suffer

The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,

Or to take arms against a sea of troubles,

And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep;

No more; and, by a sleep to say we end

The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks

That flesh is heir to, ’tis a consummation

Devoutly to be wish’d. To die, to sleep;

To sleep: perchance to dream: ay, there’s the rub.”

You looked at him, and he was smiling at you. “You sound regal when you speak like that.”

You chuckled and rubbed the reins of the horse with the pad of your thumb and nodded

“Early modern english. Elegant early modern english. Many of the common people of England didn’t really speak so eloquently. More formal than me, but not as formal as Shakespear would write.”

He nodded “A famous writer?”

You shrugged slightly “Poet, playwright. He was many things.”

title: Just my Luck
body:
Written for day 4 of @jonsadreamofspring based on the prompt “Soulmates”

Until Soulmates meet, one of them always has bad luck, while the other always has good luck. And Sansa Stark clearly has the bad luck. It’s even that bad that she manages to crash into crown prince Jon Targaryen. Just when she thought life couldn’t get any worse.

Fairy Tale AU // Soulmates AU

“I’m sorry…” Sansa shook her head while she held her backpack upside down. “I swear I had it just a few minutes ago.” Her cheeks were blushing and pearls of sweat covered her forehead. She furrowed her eyebrows when she noticed the melted chocolate stains on her book.

Of course. As if losing her wallet wasn’t bad luck enough already.

“Excuse me.” A hard shoulder brushed hers. “Is that the last one?” A blond haired woman with green eyes pointed at the apple-blue-sea-green silk on the counter. “It’s exactly the color I was looking for.”

Sansa looked up. “I’m sorry, but I had it first and it’s also the exact color I was looking for.”

“Do you have your wallet or not, miss?” The boy behind the counter raised his eyebrows and crossed his arms over his chest. A few minutes ago he had actually been quite friendly and charming, but now there was nothing but coldness and annoyance in his glance.

Sansa shook her head. “I must have lost it between here and the baker. I can go see if I can maybe find it back.” She carefully put everything in her backpack again and closed it to make sure she wouldn’t lose or damage anything else.

“In that case…” The boy behind the counter grabbed the beautifully coloured silk and handed it to the blond haired lady. “That is 50 dragons, lady Lannister.”

Sansa rolled her eyes and she threw the backpack over her shoulder while she stormed out of the shop.

Everyone who said that you got used to having bad luck all the time, must have been the one with the good luck all the time. There was no way anyone could be okay with this, could just accept this, could patiently wait for their soulmate to arrive with the good luck to finally even the odds. Being the one with the permanent bad luck sucked.

It meant constantly losing important stuff at even more important moments. It meant never getting the benefit of the doubt. And it meant that whatever could go wrong, always went wrong.

“Hey!”

Sansa stood abruptly still when she crashed into a handsome looking boy and her jaw dropped when she noticed who he was. As if things couldn’t get any worse, she also really had to make a fool of herself in front of crown prince Jon Targaryen.

Perfect, absolutely perfect. If her soulmate wouldn’t show up any time soon, she’d have to lock herself up somewhere, safely tucked away from the big bad outside world, to prevent even further damage.

“My apologies, your majesty. I am afraid I was not entirely looking where I was going.” Her already heated cheeks warmed up even more and the color of her skin was now probably matching the color of her hair.

He had his hands firmly on her shoulders to steady him and when their glances met a smile spread across his face. “I’m not complaining when a beautiful girl bumps into me.” He winked and Sansa felt her heart skipping a beat in her chest.

“O, that happens daily to you?” Sansa raised her eyebrows and she crossed her arms in front of her.

Jon shrugged. “I’m the crown prince. It’s hard to say if it’s always by accident or mostly on purpose. But I’ve always been lucky.”

Sansa rolled her eyes.

The crown prince was always lucky. Well, that made sense since he was the crown prince. Royals never got the bad luck. Probably because that bad and good luck thing already started before they were even born. They became princes because they got the good luck. That had to be it. It was at the very least really unfair.

“Good for you.” She shook his arms off and stepped back. Surprisingly enough she managed to do so elegantly. “Have a great rest of your life then.”

“Hey…” Jon reached for her hand, but missed her wrist by an inch. “Please…” He moved his arms and he widened his eyes while he tripped over his own legs and fell in a puddle of mud on the black cobbles.

Sansa raised her eyebrows, but then she realised that this was the crown prince and quickly she stepped towards him and reached out her hand. “Your majesty? Is everything alright?”

“I think so…” The frown on his forehead deepened and he stared at his expensive clothes, now covered in dirt. “This has never happened to me before. Never.” He shook his head and he stared at himself in absolute disbelief before he placed his hand in Sansa’s and allowed her to help him up.

Sansa couldn’t keep the smile from her face. “Welcome to my world.” She kept on holding onto his hand. “I’m Sansa, by the way.”

“Miss?”

Sansa closed her eyes and let out another sigh when the moment was interrupted by the high pitched voice of a small girl.

“Is this yours?” The girl walked towards her and in her hand she held the wallet Sansa had lost about twenty minutes ago. “I found it a few blocks back and I heard you telling that cashier that you had lost your wallet, so I thought…”

Sansa grabbed the wallet and her fingers trembled when she opened it. Much to her surprise all her money, the 50 dragons she had collected to finally buy that dreamlike fabric she had wanted for months now, was still in there. “Thank you…” Her voice trembled and quickly she took one of the dragons and placed it in the girl’s hand. “Here, you deserved this.”

With a happy smile on her face the girl rushed away and disappeared into the nearest candy store.

“Wow…” Sansa stared at her wallet and then she looked up at the crown prince. “That never happened to me before…” Her eyes widened when her mind pieced the pieces of the puzzle together. “O shit…”

Jon cocked his head. “What’s wrong?”

Sansa swallowed. “You just tripped for the very first time in your life, because you’ve always had good luck.” She spoke slowly to give Jon the chance to let the words sink in. “And I’ve just gotten something back I’ve lost for the very first time in my life, because I’ve always had bad luck.”

“And it happened right after we bumped into each other.” Jon’s eyes widened and then the smile on his face brightened. “It’s you.”

Sansa had stopped breathing, but eventually she nodded. “It’s me. It’s you. It’s…” She couldn’t find the right words to describe the feelings going through her. “Oh my God, I’m gonna be the next Queen.” She was not sure if that was good luck or bad luck.

Jon wrapped his arms around her however and lifted her up to twirl her around. “And what a wonderful Queen you will be.“
body_abstract:
Written for day 4 of @jonsadreamofspring based on the prompt “Soulmates”

Until Soulmates meet, one of them always has bad luck, while the other always has good luck. And Sansa Stark clearly has the bad luck. It’s even that bad that she manages to crash into crown prince Jon Targaryen. Just when she thought life couldn’t get any worse.

Fairy Tale AU // Soulmates AU

“I’m sorry…” Sansa shook her head while she held her backpack upside down. “I swear I had it just a few minutes ago.” Her cheeks were blushing and pearls of sweat covered her forehead. She furrowed her eyebrows when she noticed the melted chocolate stains on her book.

Of course. As if losing her wallet wasn’t bad luck enough already.

“Excuse me.” A hard shoulder brushed hers. “Is that the last one?” A blond haired woman with green eyes pointed at the apple-blue-sea-green silk on the counter. “It’s exactly the color I was looking for.”

Sansa looked up. “I’m sorry, but I had it first and it’s also the exact color I was looking for.”

“Do you have your wallet or not, miss?” The boy behind the counter raised his eyebrows and crossed his arms over his chest. A few minutes ago he had actually been quite friendly and charming, but now there was nothing but coldness and annoyance in his glance.

Sansa shook her head. “I must have lost it between here and the baker. I can go see if I can maybe find it back.” She carefully put everything in her backpack again and closed it to make sure she wouldn’t lose or damage anything else.

“In that case…” The boy behind the counter grabbed the beautifully coloured silk and handed it to the blond haired lady. “That is 50 dragons, lady Lannister.”

Sansa rolled her eyes and she threw the backpack over her shoulder while she stormed out of the shop.

Everyone who said that you got used to having bad luck all the time, must have been the one with the good luck all the time. There was no way anyone could be okay with this, could just accept this, could patiently wait for their soulmate to arrive with the good luck to finally even the odds. Being the one with the permanent bad luck sucked.

“Do you have your wallet or not, miss?” The boy behind the counter raised his eyebrows and crossed his arms over his chest. A few minutes ago he had actually been quite friendly and charming, but now there was nothing but coldness and annoyance in his glance.

“In that case…” The boy behind the counter grabbed the beautifully coloured silk and handed it to the blond haired lady. “That is 50 dragons, lady Lannister.”

Sansa rolled her eyes and she threw the backpack over her shoulder while she stormed out of the shop.

Everyone who said that you got used to having bad luck all the time, must have been the one with the good luck all the time. There was no way anyone could be okay with this, could just accept this, could patiently wait for their soulmate to arrive with the good luck to finally even the odds. Being the one with the permanent bad luck sucked.

[[MORE]]

It meant constantly losing important stuff at even more important moments. It meant never getting the benefit of the doubt. And it meant that whatever could go wrong, always went wrong.

“Hey!”

Sansa stood abruptly still when she crashed into a handsome looking boy and her jaw dropped when she noticed who he was. As if things couldn’t get any worse, she also really had to make a fool of herself in front of crown prince Jon Targaryen.

Perfect, absolutely perfect. If her soulmate wouldn’t show up any time soon, she’d have to lock herself up somewhere, safely tucked away from the big bad outside world, to prevent even further damage.

“My apologies, your majesty. I am afraid I was not entirely looking where I was going.” Her already heated cheeks warmed up even more and the color of her skin was now probably matching the color of her hair.

He had his hands firmly on her shoulders to steady him and when their glances met a smile spread across his face. “I’m not complaining when a beautiful girl bumps into me.” He winked and Sansa felt her heart skipping a beat in her chest.

“O, that happens daily to you?” Sansa raised her eyebrows and she crossed her arms in front of her.

Jon shrugged. “I’m the crown prince. It’s hard to say if it’s always by accident or mostly on purpose. But I’ve always been lucky.”

Sansa rolled her eyes.

The crown prince was always lucky. Well, that made sense since he was the crown prince. Royals never got the bad luck. Probably because that bad and good luck thing already started before they were even born. They became princes because they got the good luck. That had to be it. It was at the very least really unfair.

“Good for you.” She shook his arms off and stepped back. Surprisingly enough she managed to do so elegantly. “Have a great rest of your life then.”

“Hey…” Jon reached for her hand, but missed her wrist by an inch. “Please…” He moved his arms and he widened his eyes while he tripped over his own legs and fell in a puddle of mud on the black cobbles.

Sansa raised her eyebrows, but then she realised that this was the crown prince and quickly she stepped towards him and reached out her hand. “Your majesty? Is everything alright?”

“I think so…” The frown on his forehead deepened and he stared at his expensive clothes, now covered in dirt. “This has never happened to me before. Never.” He shook his head and he stared at himself in absolute disbelief before he placed his hand in Sansa’s and allowed her to help him up.

Sansa couldn’t keep the smile from her face. “Welcome to my world.” She kept on holding onto his hand. “I’m Sansa, by the way.”

“Miss?”

Sansa closed her eyes and let out another sigh when the moment was interrupted by the high pitched voice of a small girl.

“Is this yours?” The girl walked towards her and in her hand she held the wallet Sansa had lost about twenty minutes ago. “I found it a few blocks back and I heard you telling that cashier that you had lost your wallet, so I thought…”

Sansa grabbed the wallet and her fingers trembled when she opened it. Much to her surprise all her money, the 50 dragons she had collected to finally buy that dreamlike fabric she had wanted for months now, was still in there. “Thank you…” Her voice trembled and quickly she took one of the dragons and placed it in the girl’s hand. “Here, you deserved this.”

With a happy smile on her face the girl rushed away and disappeared into the nearest candy store.

“Wow…” Sansa stared at her wallet and then she looked up at the crown prince. “That never happened to me before…” Her eyes widened when her mind pieced the pieces of the puzzle together. “O shit…”

Jon cocked his head. “What’s wrong?”

Sansa swallowed. “You just tripped for the very first time in your life, because you’ve always had good luck.” She spoke slowly to give Jon the chance to let the words sink in. “And I’ve just gotten something back I’ve lost for the very first time in my life, because I’ve always had bad luck.”

“And it happened right after we bumped into each other.” Jon’s eyes widened and then the smile on his face brightened. “It’s you.”

Sansa had stopped breathing, but eventually she nodded. “It’s me. It’s you. It’s…” She couldn’t find the right words to describe the feelings going through her. “Oh my God, I’m gonna be the next Queen.” She was not sure if that was good luck or bad luck.

Jon wrapped his arms around her however and lifted her up to twirl her around. “And what a wonderful Queen you will be.“

title: Northern Ravens - Chapter 5
body:
Sansa is Queen in the North while Jon is banished to serve the Night’s Watch for the rest of his life. And yet, Sansa can’t just accept that Jon can never come home again, that he will never be able to answer the feelings she has for him, that she will have to marry someone else to let him father the future heirs of the North. And so she sends ravens. Ravens to Jon to tell him how much she misses him. And ravens to Bran to ask him when it is safe to end Jon’s punishment and bring him back to Winterfell.

Chapter 1 // Chapter 2 // Chapter 3 // Chapter 4

The served dinner in Castle Black looked far better than the food Sansa had gotten during their journey from Winterfell to the North. The smell of fresh meat filled her nostrils and even though they were not presented on the table yet Sansa could also already smell the lemon cakes Jon had without a doubt made for her.

And yet, instead of actually eating the food, Sansa played with it and shoved it back and forth on her plate. There were too many butterflies in her stomach to actually be hungry and the fact that she was seated a few too many inches away from Jon made her entire body restless. Having dinner and attempting to converse with her own people or the ones who spent their days with Jon in the cold North beyond the wall felt like wasting time.

But she kept a smile on her face and nodded whenever she thought she had to, even though she didn’t hear anything of what was said to her.

“Did you already ask him?” Fredrik shifted in the seat next to her. He still wore the Stark uniform and his plate was already half empty.

Sansa blinked a few times and then she shook her head. “I didn’t get the chance yet.” Her cheeks heated up and she saw the smile spreading across Fredrik’s face.

At times the boy reminded her of Theon and she was not sure yet if that made her happy or sad. He had the same blond curls, even though he kept them short most of the time. And just like Theon he carried a certain bravado that could come across as arrogance, but was also in a way rather charming.

“Of course, my Queen, you had more important matters to discuss.” He winked and Sansa couldn’t help but smiling back at him.

She moved her chair a little closer towards Jon and then she cleared her throat. “The men ask how they should call you now you’re no longer a King or a Lord.” She bent her head and stared at her plate. Jon had probably noticed by now that she was barely eating, but when she looked at his plate she noticed that his appetite didn’t seem like it used to be either.

Jon shrugged and he easily accepted the excuse to put his spoon down. “They can just call me Jon or Snow or whatever they like best.”

Sansa furrowed her eyebrows and she leaned back in her wooden chair. She was just as much a Queen here as she was in Winterfell and even the men of the Night’s Watch, known to be thieves and outcasts, seemed to respect everything she had accomplished and the fact that she had managed to keep Jon alive after he had killed the Dragon Queen. “You know they will never do that.”

He might have accepted that he was no longer a King or a Lord or a Knight, but his people, her people, their people had not. He had been the one commanding their army against the Night King. He had been the one leading their troops south to kill Cersei Lannister. He had also been the one ending the tyranny of Daenerys Targaryen, even though he was surrounded by those loyal to her, including her dragon. No matter how much he wanted it, not even when he ordered them to, would they see and treat him as their equal.

Westeros might have stripped him of all titles, but not even Westeros could erase everything he had done for the Kingdom and especially the North.

“I’m not allowed to carry a title.”

“Yet.” Sansa hissed between her teeth. “It’s a matter of time before Bran tells us that Daenerys’ allies have left Westeros or have stopped caring.” She lifted her chin a little and straightened her back. “Apart from that, the North is an independent Kingdom and the laws of the Six Kingdoms and their punishments can be overruled by its Queen.” She took a deep breath. “I don’t want to risk another war, even though I don’t doubt we will win it, but the Northerners and I can give you every title and all honour you deserve.”

Jon smiled, but he shook his head and reached for her hand. “Sansa…” He spoke softly. “I know that Tyrion presented it as a punishment. That’s what Grey Worm had to believe, else he wouldn’t have let me go alive.” The tips of his fingers, slightly rough after spending so much time in the burning cold, rubbed her knuckles. “But the only part of the punishment that really is one, is the part that keeps me away from you.” Every word was sincere. “I never wanted to rule people or command armies. I’m fine being a bastard, banished, but free.”

“You’re not a bastard, Jon.” Sansa shook her head. “You’ve never been and you’ll never be.”

“We’ve talked about this.” Jon leaned a little closer towards her, even though that was barely possible. “I don’t want any of it. I just want a calm life, Ghost somewhere near and you.” He lifted his hand up and touched her cheek.

She hadn’t realised that a few tears had escaped her watering eyes. “Will you even come back home if Bran tells us that you can return without risking countless of lives?” After all, that was the future she had been holding onto, the promise that had kept her going. She could rule the North and be their Queen, as long as she knew that one day Jon would come home again to be with her.

He was the only one she would ever allow to father her children, the heirs the North so desperately needed now Bran was ruling the Six Kingdoms and Jon and Arya were so far way from Winterfell.

But she didn’t want to travel all the way here for the rest of her life to see him. And she didn’t want to say goodbye after only a few weeks every time he would travel south. She couldn’t do that. She didn’t want that. That was not the happily ever after she was promised after everything she had been through and everything she had fought for.

“I already told you, Sansa.” Jon squeezed her hand assuringly. “I will be your husband one day and the father of your children and I will help you raise those children to become King or Queen themselves one day.” He let her hand go. “But as just Jon. In your shadow.”
body_abstract:
Sansa is Queen in the North while Jon is banished to serve the Night’s Watch for the rest of his life. And yet, Sansa can’t just accept that Jon can never come home again, that he will never be able to answer the feelings she has for him, that she will have to marry someone else to let him father the future heirs of the North. And so she sends ravens. Ravens to Jon to tell him how much she misses him. And ravens to Bran to ask him when it is safe to end Jon’s punishment and bring him back to Winterfell.

Chapter 1 // Chapter 2 // Chapter 3 // Chapter 4

The served dinner in Castle Black looked far better than the food Sansa had gotten during their journey from Winterfell to the North. The smell of fresh meat filled her nostrils and even though they were not presented on the table yet Sansa could also already smell the lemon cakes Jon had without a doubt made for her.

And yet, instead of actually eating the food, Sansa played with it and shoved it back and forth on her plate. There were too many butterflies in her stomach to actually be hungry and the fact that she was seated a few too many inches away from Jon made her entire body restless. Having dinner and attempting to converse with her own people or the ones who spent their days with Jon in the cold North beyond the wall felt like wasting time.

But she kept a smile on her face and nodded whenever she thought she had to, even though she didn’t hear anything of what was said to her.

“Did you already ask him?” Fredrik shifted in the seat next to her. He still wore the Stark uniform and his plate was already half empty.

Sansa blinked a few times and then she shook her head. “I didn’t get the chance yet.” Her cheeks heated up and she saw the smile spreading across Fredrik’s face.

At times the boy reminded her of Theon and she was not sure yet if that made her happy or sad. He had the same blond curls, even though he kept them short most of the time. And just like Theon he carried a certain bravado that could come across as arrogance, but was also in a way rather charming.

“Of course, my Queen, you had more important matters to discuss.” He winked and Sansa couldn’t help but smiling back at him.

“Of course, my Queen, you had more important matters to discuss.” He winked and Sansa couldn’t help but smiling back at him.

[[MORE]]

She moved her chair a little closer towards Jon and then she cleared her throat. “The men ask how they should call you now you’re no longer a King or a Lord.” She bent her head and stared at her plate. Jon had probably noticed by now that she was barely eating, but when she looked at his plate she noticed that his appetite didn’t seem like it used to be either.

Jon shrugged and he easily accepted the excuse to put his spoon down. “They can just call me Jon or Snow or whatever they like best.”

Sansa furrowed her eyebrows and she leaned back in her wooden chair. She was just as much a Queen here as she was in Winterfell and even the men of the Night’s Watch, known to be thieves and outcasts, seemed to respect everything she had accomplished and the fact that she had managed to keep Jon alive after he had killed the Dragon Queen. “You know they will never do that.”

He might have accepted that he was no longer a King or a Lord or a Knight, but his people, her people, their people had not. He had been the one commanding their army against the Night King. He had been the one leading their troops south to kill Cersei Lannister. He had also been the one ending the tyranny of Daenerys Targaryen, even though he was surrounded by those loyal to her, including her dragon. No matter how much he wanted it, not even when he ordered them to, would they see and treat him as their equal.

Westeros might have stripped him of all titles, but not even Westeros could erase everything he had done for the Kingdom and especially the North.

“I’m not allowed to carry a title.”

“Yet.” Sansa hissed between her teeth. “It’s a matter of time before Bran tells us that Daenerys’ allies have left Westeros or have stopped caring.” She lifted her chin a little and straightened her back. “Apart from that, the North is an independent Kingdom and the laws of the Six Kingdoms and their punishments can be overruled by its Queen.” She took a deep breath. “I don’t want to risk another war, even though I don’t doubt we will win it, but the Northerners and I can give you every title and all honour you deserve.”

Jon smiled, but he shook his head and reached for her hand. “Sansa…” He spoke softly. “I know that Tyrion presented it as a punishment. That’s what Grey Worm had to believe, else he wouldn’t have let me go alive.” The tips of his fingers, slightly rough after spending so much time in the burning cold, rubbed her knuckles. “But the only part of the punishment that really is one, is the part that keeps me away from you.” Every word was sincere. “I never wanted to rule people or command armies. I’m fine being a bastard, banished, but free.”

“You’re not a bastard, Jon.” Sansa shook her head. “You’ve never been and you’ll never be.”

“We’ve talked about this.” Jon leaned a little closer towards her, even though that was barely possible. “I don’t want any of it. I just want a calm life, Ghost somewhere near and you.” He lifted his hand up and touched her cheek.

She hadn’t realised that a few tears had escaped her watering eyes. “Will you even come back home if Bran tells us that you can return without risking countless of lives?” After all, that was the future she had been holding onto, the promise that had kept her going. She could rule the North and be their Queen, as long as she knew that one day Jon would come home again to be with her.

He was the only one she would ever allow to father her children, the heirs the North so desperately needed now Bran was ruling the Six Kingdoms and Jon and Arya were so far way from Winterfell.

But she didn’t want to travel all the way here for the rest of her life to see him. And she didn’t want to say goodbye after only a few weeks every time he would travel south. She couldn’t do that. She didn’t want that. That was not the happily ever after she was promised after everything she had been through and everything she had fought for.

“I already told you, Sansa.” Jon squeezed her hand assuringly. “I will be your husband one day and the father of your children and I will help you raise those children to become King or Queen themselves one day.” He let her hand go. “But as just Jon. In your shadow.”

blog.name: thestomping-ground
blog.title: The Big G's Stomping Ground
blog.description: My personal corner of the internet where I talk about Anime, TV, Movies, Sports, Comic Books, and Godzilla.

summary: Big G’s Theory crafting: Jon & Dany’s ending in the Books.
title: Big G’s Theory crafting: Jon & Dany’s ending in the Books.
body:
Needless to say we’re all in sour moods of how the show ended Jon and Dany. But a lot of us book readers are all coming to the same conclusion: the REAL ending has to be more satisfying as opposed to hollow, cheap and VERY unearned. 

So i’ve been mulling over some things and I THINK I might have cracked the Da GRRM code on what could go down by the end of this all. First we have to accept these two points:

  1. Jon kills Dany
  2. Jon goes into Exile beyond the Wall with the Free Folk

These are VERY VERY broad brushstrokes. And upsetting as they can make us…it’s possible to make these ideas work. Hell the show could have made them work, but D&D decided only 13 episodes was necessary. To which I say BULLSHIT. 

Let’s talk Dany first. 

We last left Dany captured by the Dothraki. The show had her basically taken back to Vales Dothrak where she torched the Khals and in the Dosh Kaleen Temple and pretty much became the Khal of Khals. Or Khaleesi of Khals. Whatever you wanna call her. She became the Stallion that Mounted the world and returned to Mereen to defeat the slavers. 

I think book Dany is going to go on a MUCH different journey. Which I think is all going to be maybe the first quarter/third of her story in WoW. I am convinced that Dany will make it to Asshai sometime before halfway through the book. What she’ll learn there…no clue but she’ll be there. Then she’ll return to Mereen and get things in order, but i’m convinced that by halfway of her story….she’ll be headed on her way to Weteros. With a possible layover in Volantis. 

The back half of her story will be dealing with Fake Aegon. And I think D&D ended up incorporating too much of Faegon and Dany’s story into show Jon and Dany’s story. KL could very well end up torched by Dany or shit KL could very well be torched by the time she gets there. Remember Faegon’s already in Westeros with the Golden Company. 

The last part of WoW (and I’m talking the last quarter to third or even possibly the last chapter or so) will be all about Jon and Dany. And the beginning of their love.  Which will be much more intense and deep…but will still end tragically. For Dany will “redeem” herself during the Long Night. She will be the spark that lights the Fire of Hope for those who fight back against the cold. Yes making Dany a martyr is cliche and not creative. But I trust GRRM to make it work (provided he manages to make it that far). 

But the big thing for Dany, before her sacrifice and ultimately her fall at the hands of her “Betrayal of Love” from Jon. Is that before she dies, Daenerys Targaryen will hold in her arms a living child born from her womb. The show denied us boatbaby but the books will not. In the end Daenerys Targaryen will be remembered as the flame of hope, not a “tyrant”. 

This takes us to Jon. 

The big change with Jon, is that when Jon’s soul/mind comes back from Ghost. He’s gunna be a beastman. Dare i say almost a ASOIAF version of a werewolf. The first half of his WoW story will be about him coming back, regaining a sense of himself and then meeting Dany. 

Now during Jon’s “Wolf Days” post Resurrection, we’re going to see the character of Val take center stage. While I think a lot of us wrote Val off as just Jon’s version of Daario. But I think she’s gunna play a bigger role than any of us gave her credit for. She will be instrumental in bringing Jon back to his senses, AND the two of them will sleep together at one point. AND kicker….Jon will father a child on her…a son. BUT Jon and Val will part ways before ether of them realizes that she’s pregnant. 

SO Jon and Dany will meet. Fall in love. A beautiful, joyful yet short love. More than just some boatsex and a dragon ride. I’m talking friendship, companionship, love, they’re going to bare their tired and scared souls to one another and they’re going to discover that all along they’ve been searching for one another and will climax with them having a daughter. But to defeat the Others…they will realize they wont be able to have their Red Door and Lemon Tree. Dany will sacrifice herself to Jon and the day will be won. 

The survivors will look to Jon for leadership because at this point…his heritage will be known. But Jon will reject it. He will reject the Southern Political schemes and machinations of the South. He will chose to be free and not some puppet for schemers like say BookTyrion. This opens up for a King Bran scenario oddly enough. 

Thinking himself a Kinslayer/Oathbreaker/Queenslayer and knowing that his daughter will no doubt be used as a puppet of the South being the last “Pure” Targaryen (even though she’s a quarter Stark). Jon then takes the babe and goes North beyond the Wall into Exile. 

There he oddly enough meets up with Val and learns that he has a son. Now of course Jon’s going to feel like shit about this…but Val will set him straight. Jon will then name his daughter “Daenerys’ after her mother, and will work with Val (and Ghost because Best Boy is Best Boy) to raise their son “Robb”.  Almost a mirror to Ned coming back after the Rebellion with Jon in tow 

Jon/Val won’t be your typical “Endgame” because Jon will still love Dany. But he will have some peace because Dany will always be with him through their daughter. 

OK…yeah. So this is a way I could see the whole thing ending. As much as I would love a happy ending of Jon & Dany hopping on Drogon, grabbing Ghost and giving the bird to westeors and moving to the south shore of Lys to live at their beach-side Villa complete with red door and lemon tree…I don’t think it’s going to happen. 

Dany dying as a martyr to save her people from the ultimate form of slavery is more in tune with who Daenerys Targaryen is as a character than having her die as she tries to seduce Jon to her “New Targ World Order” after putting a city of thousands to the dragon torch. 

Is it still a shitty unfair ending for Dany? Yes. But I really dont’ see how Dany makes it out alive in the books now. I’d love nothing more for the final chapter to be of her and Jon with their child somewhere in peace. But I don’t think we’re gunna get that ending, no matter how much I want it. No matter how much the characters want it. 

I’d rather Dany die to protect the living from the slavery of undeath and be remembered as a hero…than have her die in the most unemotional overdone way possible. 

As for Jon. He’ll have to live with the fact that he killed his soulmate, but he’ll be free from the ambitions and politics of the south. And he’ll have two children to love and raise. House Targaryen will be reborn but not in the way we thought. A Dragon is not a Slave. A Dragon is free….and who is more free than the Free Folk?

KL could very well end up torched by Dany or shit KL could very well be torched by the time she gets there. Remember Faegon’s already in Westeros with the Golden Company. 

The last part of WoW (and I’m talking the last quarter to third or even possibly the last chapter or so) will be all about Jon and Dany. And the beginning of their love.  Which will be much more intense and deep…but will still end tragically. For Dany will “redeem” herself during the Long Night. She will be the spark that lights the Fire of Hope for those who fight back against the cold. Yes making Dany a martyr is cliche and not creative. But I trust GRRM to make it work (provided he manages to make it that far). 

But the big thing for Dany, before her sacrifice and ultimately her fall at the hands of her “Betrayal of Love” from Jon. Is that before she dies, Daenerys Targaryen will hold in her arms a living child born from her womb. The show denied us boatbaby but the books will not. In the end Daenerys Targaryen will be remembered as the flame of hope, not a “tyrant”. 

This takes us to Jon. 

The big change with Jon, is that when Jon’s soul/mind comes back from Ghost. He’s gunna be a beastman. Dare i say almost a ASOIAF version of a werewolf. The first half of his WoW story will be about him coming back, regaining a sense of himself and then meeting Dany. 

Now during Jon’s “Wolf Days” post Resurrection, we’re going to see the character of Val take center stage. While I think a lot of us wrote Val off as just Jon’s version of Daario. But I think she’s gunna play a bigger role than any of us gave her credit for. She will be instrumental in bringing Jon back to his senses, AND the two of them will sleep together at one point. AND kicker….Jon will father a child on her…a son. BUT Jon and Val will part ways before ether of them realizes that she’s pregnant. 

SO Jon and Dany will meet. Fall in love. A beautiful, joyful yet short love. More than just some boatsex and a dragon ride. I’m talking friendship, companionship, love, they’re going to bare their tired and scared souls to one another and they’re going to discover that all along they’ve been searching for one another and will climax with them having a daughter. But to defeat the Others…they will realize they wont be able to have their Red Door and Lemon Tree. Dany will sacrifice herself to Jon and the day will be won. 

The survivors will look to Jon for leadership because at this point…his heritage will be known. But Jon will reject it. He will reject the Southern Political schemes and machinations of the South. He will chose to be free and not some puppet for schemers like say BookTyrion. This opens up for a King Bran scenario oddly enough. 

Thinking himself a Kinslayer/Oathbreaker/Queenslayer and knowing that his daughter will no doubt be used as a puppet of the South being the last “Pure” Targaryen (even though she’s a quarter Stark). Jon then takes the babe and goes North beyond the Wall into Exile. 

There he oddly enough meets up with Val and learns that he has a son. Now of course Jon’s going to feel like shit about this…but Val will set him straight. Jon will then name his daughter “Daenerys’ after her mother, and will work with Val (and Ghost because Best Boy is Best Boy) to raise their son “Robb”.  Almost a mirror to Ned coming back after the Rebellion with Jon in tow 

Jon/Val won’t be your typical “Endgame” because Jon will still love Dany. But he will have some peace because Dany will always be with him through their daughter. 

OK…yeah. So this is a way I could see the whole thing ending. As much as I would love a happy ending of Jon & Dany hopping on Drogon, grabbing Ghost and giving the bird to westeors and moving to the south shore of Lys to live at their beach-side Villa complete with red door and lemon tree…I don’t think it’s going to happen. 

Dany dying as a martyr to save her people from the ultimate form of slavery is more in tune with who Daenerys Targaryen is as a character than having her die as she tries to seduce Jon to her “New Targ World Order” after putting a city of thousands to the dragon torch. 

Is it still a shitty unfair ending for Dany? Yes. But I really dont’ see how Dany makes it out alive in the books now. I’d love nothing more for the final chapter to be of her and Jon with their child somewhere in peace. But I don’t think we’re gunna get that ending, no matter how much I want it. No matter how much the characters want it. 

I’d rather Dany die to protect the living from the slavery of undeath and be remembered as a hero…than have her die in the most unemotional overdone way possible. 

As for Jon. He’ll have to live with the fact that he killed his soulmate, but he’ll be free from the ambitions and politics of the south. And he’ll have two children to love and raise. House Targaryen will be reborn but not in the way we thought. A Dragon is not a Slave. A Dragon is free….and who is more free than the Free Folk?

summary: Til Death Do Us Part... - Life with Jon 19 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/rWxjgTa6FX  Ilva the Winter had always imagined her...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Life with Jon 19 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/rWxjgTa6FX 

Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. 

*A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

summary: Hi yes love your fics. A few months ago you speculated about a s7 au where Rickon is alive and goes with Jon to dragonstone and...
question: Hi yes love your fics. A few months ago you speculated about a s7 au where Rickon is alive and goes with Jon to dragonstone and then calls Jon out on his heart eyes. where is it? i would read that in a heartbeat. The simple conjecture you proposed increased my all-encompassing love for Rickon Stark by a factor of 10. Thank you and have A very wonderful day.
answer:
Welcome, welcome to the nuthouse. Here we eat cereal and call it dinner and take drags from fake cigars. That is what it takes to become part of my cult-FAN BASE! My fan base.

Anyways, I know exactly the fic you’re talking about. That was a fic I was writing with a political marriage aspect because I realized it was stupid how the finale of S6 ends with Dany breaking up with Daario saying the best way to make alliances are with marriage, having Jon become Westeros’ most eligible bachelor and then proceeding to ignore the topic until it suited them to destroy Jonerys in S8.

There was no logical reason for Tyrion to not bring it up. Know why? Because HE was the one to convince Dany to breakup with Daario due to a marriage alliance. Why didn’t he bring it up? Jon was KING of the North and the Vale. (Should also be the Riverlands but these dumbasses ignored it until Edmure made his pop up in the finale.) Who was Tyrion waiting for? Dorne, The Reach and the (presumably) The Iron Islands were in control of women. (Ellaria, Olenna and Yara). The Vale answered to Jon! The Riverlands was also wise to be assumed to answer to Jon. She sure as hell wasnt marrying Jaime! Jon was literally the ONLY option. He was stubborn and didn’t kneel. Daenerys literally plans to marry Hizdahr in order for peace in Mereen. Why wouldn’t she marry Jon to bring THREE kingdoms that make up an entire half to her side?

Sorry for the rant. On to your question. I have about 2-3k words written before A Dragon Will Take Us Home hit me in the face.

summary: just a little longer — jon snow
title: just a little longer — jon snow
body:
notes: it has been a while since i rewatched the earlier seasons of game of thrones but this is written when jon was about to leave winterfell. feedbacks are so appreciated and it has been a while since i wrote for game of thrones again, so go easy guys! enjoy, love u lots! 

warnings: a bit smutty, perhaps in the beginning :)

————

His kisses feels like sweet candied apples that only sells out for a day and you were grateful that with every moment with him— he was your candied apple. His stubble tickles your neck as his mouth sucked and licked your neck gloriously against the cold winter air. His hand rests on your hip, sliding up and down as your body moved to the rhythm of his body. His other hand cradled your head, and inches down to the tips of your hair as he pulled on them to expose more skin. He once mentioned that your neck was one of his favorite places to feast on. Small, bruised marks graced your neck one day— and it has been your favorite thing that he has ever done. His lips nibbled on your skin, and that spot underneath your ear. That was when you groaned in the darkness—his hand quickly covering your mouth. His eyes twinkled in delight but also in nervousness, quick to wonder if somebody could hear the both of you.

Then he took his hand off of your mouth, and cupped your chin as he whispered against your lips to keep quiet, to be still, and to come. His body went rigid against your shuddering figure as your moans filled his ears and he grinned widely as he closed his eyes. It was his favorite sound— to hear you break down before him in pleasure of his doing, feeling you writhe as he continued to work on you, and feel his fingers around your mouth as he felt you guide his long fingers for one more round. He opened his eyes, and now it was your time to devour him. His curly locks got in the way of his exposed skin, and your fingers got to working out his top as he watched you— continuing to work you up again.

He continued to watch you. He feasts himself on the idea of you— the way you groan his name, the way you whisper it softly once the hazy daylight fills in his room, the way you would hold him down as he gets himself dragged in under the bed for a couple of minutes, and most importantly, the way that the words would roll of your tongue as you gazed at him.

“Jon,” you whimpered, arching your back and feeling his stubble in contact with your neck. “Oh, gods…”

“Jon?”

Both of you stopped moving, his lips stopped sucking your neck, and he slowly reappeared in your vision. He was flushed against you, flustered with the cold wind and shocked to hear a familiar voice.

“Jon?”

Oswald, the stableman, asked again. Oswald was a big, old man with the deepest voice and by this point, you have already memorize what would happen. Oswald would appear in the stables, his eyes squinting in the dark as Jon again would place a hand over your mouth. You hitched a breath as he placed hs two fingers in your entrance, and worked his way up again. He curbed them inside you, feeling your back arch again— in pleasure and anticipation if both of you would ever get caught.

Oswald was also partially blind, already.

So it was a game between you and Jon.

Will you get caught?

Will Oswald spill the activity happening in his stable to the Lord of Winterfell?

Jon shushed you with his lips, biting down on your lower lip to catch it between his. That was how he shut you up. Jon pulled away, placing his forehead against yours and feeling the tiny beads of sweat on his skin. Both of you perked up when the thud of footsteps echoed out in the stables, and then you were left alone now.

“I told you,” Jon whispered against your lips. He helped you with your undergarments, lifting up your heavy skirts as you rested them against your waist. “We will never get caught.”

“It seems that Jon Snow is right again, huh?”

“It seems that way, my lady.”

His eyes crinkled at the ends as he grinned, helping you lace your top. Once he was done, he picked up the fur on the ground and placed it around your shoulders. He fixed up his trousers, lacing them all the way up as your fingers laced his shirt.

He placed a kiss on the crown of your head, towering over you as he held you in his arms all of a sudden. You knew what was happening, and you tried your hardest to smile through the pain. Jon held you longer until he felt your arms creep up and hold him by the shoulder. The cold wind has nothing against the warmth of your bodies, and Jon deeply sighed as he kissed you gently. He pulled away, his thumb resting on your lower lip.

“Will you be back?”

Jon sighed, and held out his hand as he guided you back to your quarters. He didn’t answer your question not until you were inside. Then he looked down on his feet, and you glimpsed at the man you love. He was the quiet and timid man— acting as if he was smaller than every one but he was one of the bravest you have ever seen. You loved his fierceness, dedication, and his drive for the better good.

It was a stupid question, and you know it.

You smiled, holding the knob of the door as Jon rocked on his heel. You squeezed his hand as he looked up to the meet your eyes. You knew the answer and it baffled you everytime Jon would be silent on the issue. Jon deeply sighed again, and he laid a quick kiss on your forehead.

“Go to sleep, my love, and I will see you in the morning,” he whispered as he walked away from your door. You looked down on the way, waiting for the silence to settle as you knew he was far away now.

In the morning, when Lord Stark and everybody has been settled on in their horses, when all the house sigils have been flagged up, all the lords and ladies of Winterfelle and commoners alike, it was time to bid farewell.

Quick glances and sneaky kisses and it was time to bid him farewell.

He straightened on his horse, and he turned his neck towards you. He nodded quickly— his eyes never leaving yours as the gates opened and slowly, they marched into the greater roads outside the wall of Winterfell.

No one knows about your time with Jon. Nobody knows why your eyes were red and your nose was running as the gates closed. Older women fussed over you— giving you cups of warm water and herbal drink to ease the cold. Nobody can sympathize with you because nobody knows that you shared something with Jon. It was a secret. A good kept secret— and it doomed your heart because you wanted him to stay, you wanted him to kiss you on the lips in broad daylight as the onlookers watched, you wanted him to hold you when you walk, and you wanted him to be with you a day longer, to feel him laugh in the morning as you harshly took back to thick furs on your gowned body as he shares a bed with you.

He always hogs the furs and the thick covers— and you wanted to him to do it again even if it all it did was annoy you.

Just one more day.

But all you could do was walk with your head high, eyes that never watered, and a tough heart as you walked in the plaza as if Jon has never been with you.

“Go to sleep, my love, and I will see you in the morning,” he whispered as he walked away from your door. You looked down on the way, waiting for the silence to settle as you knew he was far away now.

In the morning, when Lord Stark and everybody has been settled on in their horses, when all the house sigils have been flagged up, all the lords and ladies of Winterfelle and commoners alike, it was time to bid farewell.

Quick glances and sneaky kisses and it was time to bid him farewell.

He straightened on his horse, and he turned his neck towards you. He nodded quickly— his eyes never leaving yours as the gates opened and slowly, they marched into the greater roads outside the wall of Winterfell.

No one knows about your time with Jon. Nobody knows why your eyes were red and your nose was running as the gates closed. Older women fussed over you— giving you cups of warm water and herbal drink to ease the cold. Nobody can sympathize with you because nobody knows that you shared something with Jon. It was a secret. A good kept secret— and it doomed your heart because you wanted him to stay, you wanted him to kiss you on the lips in broad daylight as the onlookers watched, you wanted him to hold you when you walk, and you wanted him to be with you a day longer, to feel him laugh in the morning as you harshly took back to thick furs on your gowned body as he shares a bed with you.

He always hogs the furs and the thick covers— and you wanted to him to do it again even if it all it did was annoy you.

Just one more day.

But all you could do was walk with your head high, eyes that never watered, and a tough heart as you walked in the plaza as if Jon has never been with you.

His kisses feels like sweet candied apples that only sells out for a day and you were grateful that with every moment with him— he was your candied apple. His stubble tickles your neck as his mouth sucked and licked your neck gloriously against the cold winter air. His hand rests on your hip, sliding up and down as your body moved to the rhythm of his body. His other hand cradled your head, and inches down to the tips of your hair as he pulled on them to expose more skin. He once mentioned that your neck was one of his favorite places to feast on. Small, bruised marks graced your neck one day— and it has been your favorite thing that he has ever done. His lips nibbled on your skin, and that spot underneath your ear. That was when you groaned in the darkness—his hand quickly covering your mouth. His eyes twinkled in delight but also in nervousness, quick to wonder if somebody could hear the both of you.
